critique: This executive order focuses on improving educational opportunities for American Indian and Alaska Native students. It establishes the White House Initiative on American Indian and Alaska Native Education and directs federal agencies to develop plans to support AI/AN students. The order emphasizes tribal sovereignty and cultural preservation. It does not directly address immigration, national security, or economic regulation. It promotes social inclusion and federalism by directing federal resources to tribal education. There is no indication of deregulation, restriction of liberties, or conformity. The order seems to expand executive power by creating a new initiative and directing agencies to develop plans.
